subject: Re: [junit] htmlunit
msgSnippet: And indeed, Watij, is what we have started using for just exactly the reasons you mention and with exactly the limitations you mention. Unfortunately, our
messageBody:
And indeed, Watij, is what we have started using for just exactly the
reasons you mention and with exactly the limitations you mention.
Unfortunately, our application only works in IE on Windows (we inherited it
that way), so at this point I guess that's not a problem. (No more so than
the fact that it only runs in IE on Windows normally is.)

I just miss using HttpUnit. :-(

Simon

On 8/22/07, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> One angle on the problem is Watij: it's only for IE, and only on
> Windows, but that's better than nothing. It runs the browser
> directly, so the browser runs the JavaScript. If there are
> newer-fangled solutions these days, I'd love to hear them.
>
> David Saff
>
>
> On 8/21/07, Simon Chappell <simonpeterchappell@...<simonpeterchappell%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> > On 8/21/07, hi@... <hi%40hi.com> <jobs4wil@...<jobs4wil%40yahoo.com>>
> wrote:
> >
> > > Hi,
> > > Can you someone tell me if anyone has used htmlunit to
> > > test ajax web applications? If so, does htmlunit work
> > > with heavy javascript applications? And how does your
> > > organization like it/support it? Is it easy to
> > > maintain?
> >
> > I've had no luck with testing JavaScript-heavy applications using
> > HttpUnit (which HtmlUnit is based upon) so I'll be interested to hear
> > if anyone has managed to get it to work.
> >
> > Simon
